thread.title: Developer announces plan to create five new hotels in Belfast | UTV
thread.title_full: Developer announces plan to create five new hotels in Belfast | UTV - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Developer announces plan to create five new hotels in Belfast | UTV
text:
Sorry, this content isn't available on your device.
Two new hotels - including one with a George Best theme - are set to be developed in Belfast this year, with a plan to create three more, it has been announced.
Signature Living who intend to develop the hotels in the city, say their portfolio will generate up to 500 jobs.
Speaking at Tuesday's announcement, Director Lawrence Kenwright said he was impressed by the city after visiting MIPIM, an annual global property investment conference, which is at the centre of a Belfast city council’s marketing strategy.
Judith Hill @JudeHill_utv Follow Hotel Developer says they haven't found a home for George Best hotel yet but are in negotiations @ utvnews https://t.co/2x3wik8lYi
11:44 - 21 Feb 2017 Retweet Reply Favourite He said: “I am confident that Belfast is an excellent city in which to invest and, to that end, have committed to commencing development of two new city centre hotels in 2017 – one of which will have a strong George Best theme.
“All together we are looking to create five hotels in the city and are very close to agreeing terms for the acquisition of a landmark building.
“These hotels will not only boost Belfast’s already thriving tourism sector, but will contribute significantly to the local economy through the creation of up to 500 jobs during and post-development.”
Welcoming the announcement, Belfast City Council’s chief executive Suzanne Wylie said they are aiming to build on the momentum of development currently happening in the city.
“The council is playing its part with our 20-year strategy – the Belfast Agenda – which aims to increase our population by 70,000 and create 50,000 jobs, as well as deliver as Local Development Plan, that paves the way for these targets to be met,” she said.
“But we recognise that none of this can be achieved without a collaborative effort with the private sector, our city intuitions and Invest NI. For that reason I am delighted at the level of support we have secured for our attendance at MIPIM next month and I believe we can build on the success of last year’s event.”
Play video Last updated Tue 21 Feb 2017 Business Northern Ireland Belfast
